author: jasonframe
content: Looking at fixing some edge cases in Besu for withdrawals when withdrawals overflows an account https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/blob/main/fillers/withdrawals/withdrawals.py#L640. Wondering what the correct thing to do is when there are multiple withdrawals and one withdrawal overflows? Is the expected behaviour that only the withdrawals that don't overflow have their account balance incremented? There doesn't appear to be a test case for this.

author: ralexstokes
content: there isn't enough ether for a withdrawal to ever overflow an account, ill go get some more context on this particular test

author: ralexstokes
content: the idea is that (regardless of withdrawals) the effect of the block is to overflow an account and so the block is invalid

author: ralexstokes
content: so you'd want to rollback _all_ of the state changes from that block
